text: Anyone know where I can add/remove js files that are in the site footer just below where the linked template JS files are tagged? It looks like a couple of them are duplicate of the site_search_results js. Maybe they are being injected from modules?
Are you sure HS is injecting duplicate script ? :thinking_face:
Nope. I just can’t find anywhere in the template, page, or other design manager areas where they are being called out.
What I really want is to minify the template.js file.
well, do you have an example page i can check to see why this script are here ?
Sure: <https://www.seewhatsnext-career.com/blog>
It is only on the blog and blog posts
which one seems unused for you ?
My thought was to remove the template.js link and then re add it via the template so that it could be minified.
wow too deep for me , i don’t know how  template work  ^^ i can just check if this file is really used ^^
Check site settings for scripts and styles
I would get a hold of <@UA5DFM7CK>
Well it seems that it’s a polyfill for old browser
but it’s very light no need to minified
You mean in the header/footer area of the blog and/or page settings? Nothing there…

There is a portal wide section for script includes, in addition to the _page specific_ header / footer includes section, you check both?
<https://p191.p3.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/qGuv6wpk/Image%202020-10-28%20at%2010.32.21%20AM.png?v=35d0d3f09d250990d0c98950d8aac590>
Checked. Nothing.
Is it the site_search js that you are wondering about? You have a site search input, and site search results module in your blog template, and each are bringing in their own js.
That is what I figured for some of it. The same for template.js?
Hey <@U01D658MYFQ> Do You want the edit a module?
Hi! thanks for replying. I’m trying to figure out why the ‘add’ and ‘design’ fields are disabled.
Most likely, this module is created in pure html.
Oh, so there’s no way to enable those features?
To create an editable module you must use the language of HubSpot HubL, this exists in a drag and drop within create new module
The other way to edit it is inside the html and find where the css is integrated
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules>
Check This
Anybody has an idea what this second option does? It’s on the Image fields
Nvm, found it already! You can opt for the image to lazy load it instead of the default. Pretty handy when there are tons of images on a page below the top fold.
